channel.title: Whonix LIVE - Testers Wanted!
channel.description:
Whonix VirtualBox/KVM Live-mode!
**Whonix now has the option of booting into a live system . When live-mode is chosen, all write operations will go to RAM instead of the hard disk. The primary objective of live-mode is to prevent malware from gaining a persistent foothold and to return the system to its state prior to booting.**
[![Ambox warning pn.svg.png\ 40x35](https://www.whonix.org/w/images/thumb/f/f7/Ambox_warning_pn.svg.png/40px-Ambox_warning_pn.svg.png)](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/File:Ambox_warning_pn.svg.png) Live mode is not amnesic; in particular, memory forensics has not been taken into account!
----
**System with low resources:**
If Whonix is running on a system will low RAM it is recommended that all non-essential processes are shutdown on the host. This will free up memory for virtual machine allocation, if needed.
----
**Configuration instructions for live-mode:**
[https://whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live#Live-mode_Configuration](https://whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live#Live-mode_Configuration)
**Note**: Live-mode [is](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live#Qubes) currently [unsupported](https://whonix.org/wiki/Unsupported) with [Qubes-Whonix](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes). In Qubes R4, [Qubes DisposableVMs](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Qubes/DisposableVM) are a suitable alternative, as well as the [Qubes Live USB](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/live-usb/).
----
**Follow Whonix live-mode Development:**
https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-live-mode/3894
Thanks to @Algernon and everyone else who made live-mode possible.
----

item.title: Whonix LIVE - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: glass
item.description:
Recently tested the Whonix live mode. Set my KVM virtual disks to read-only as per the setup instructions. Even downloaded a couple files. Rebooted into normal Whonix mode and as expected, the downloaded files are gone. Also tested bookmarking a site. Again as expected once I rebooted into normal Whonix mode, the bookmark was no longer there. Video and audio worked fine in Live mode. Using it felt no different than if I was in standard Whonix mode. I had both the Gateway and Workstation in Whonix Live modes together. No issues.

item.title: Whonix LIVE - Testers Wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix VirtualBox/KVM Live-mode!

Whonix now has the option of booting into a live system . When live-mode is chosen, all write operations will go to RAM instead of the hard disk. The primary objective of live-mode is to prevent malware from gaining a persistent foothold and to return the system to its state prior to booting.

Live mode is not amnesic; in particular, memory forensics has not been taken into account!

System with low resources:

If Whonix is running on a system will low RAM it is recommended that all non-essential processes are shutdown on the host. This will free up memory for virtual machine allocation, if needed.

Configuration instructions for live-mode:

https://whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Live#Live-mode_Configuration

Note: Live-mode is currently unsupported with Qubes-Whonix. In Qubes R4, Qubes DisposableVMs are a suitable alternative, as well as the Qubes Live USB.

Follow Whonix live-mode Development:

Whonix live mode / amnesia / amnesic / non-persistent / anti-forensics Development
Is there any interest in running whonix in live mode? I came across this (Raspbian with Read-only Root - Raspberry Pi Forums) a while ago and tested it on a debian vm. It only requires a small patch to the initramfs and minor changes in the grub config. With the setup you could run whonix always as a live system. Writes would go to RAM by default. But e.g. by choosing another boot option you could boot into an “update-mode” where you install updates, new software or make other persistent chan…

Thanks to @Algernon and everyone else who made live-mode possible.

Whonix – 28 Apr 21

VM Live Mode: Stop Persistent Malware

Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent memory (RAM) instead of the hard disk. This is NOT an anti-forensics feature! For anti-forensics, check out Host Live Mode.

Whonix – 28 Apr 21

Host Live Mode: Boot existing Host Operating System into Live Mode

Add a Live Mode entry to the grub boot menu on your existing Debian host platform. Stop Persistent Malware. Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent storage (RAM) instead of the hard disk.

Whonix – 1 Mar 21

grub-live: Boot existing Host Operating System or VM into Live Mode

Add a Live Mode entry to the grub boot menu on your existing Debian host platform. Stop Persistent Malware. Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent storage (RAM) instead of the hard disk.
